main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a yellow object in the NE sky that initially appeared disc-shaped but was later identified as a box kite when viewed through binoculars.
interesting points: The object was observed for 15 minutes and remained stationary during that time., It was described as being diamond-shaped with a black spot and connected to a whitish-yellow disc., Multiple witnesses corroborated seeing the same object, all agreeing it was a box kite., The sighting occurred at approximately 1915 hours on 10 July 1949., The observer estimated the object was slightly larger than an F-80 and at an altitude of about 1000 feet.
sighted object: yellow diamond-shaped object connected to a whitish-yellow disc
witness description: civilian observers including at least two women and their husbands, who described the object in similar terms
